definition: to pick flowers/to enter houses at night in order to rape women
to pick/to pluck/to collect/to select/to choose/to gather
color/complexion/looks/variant of 彩[cai3]/variant of 採|采[cai3]
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: The Qiao son really thinks cachinnation, although she is terrified to horrify this to adopt to spend a thief.
sentences.chinese: 巧儿很想大笑，不过她怕吓到了这个采花贼。

sentences.english: Little children are gathering flowers in the field.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子们正在田野里采花。

sentences.english: They are gathering flowers in the garden.
A girl to a cliff Caihua, accidentally fell into a gorge.
sentences.chinese: 一个少女到悬崖上采花，不慎掉进了峡谷。

sentences.english: She picks as quickly as she can, but she is quite distracted.
sentences.chinese: 她倾其所能，快速采花，可是她却有些神不守舍。

sentences.english: They even flew a few kilometers away to collect nectar collected pollen.
sentences.chinese: 它们甚至会飞到几公里之外的地方去采蜜采花粉。

sentences.english: Who shall bring to perfection the well-taught path of wisdom as an expert garland-maker would his floral design?
sentences.chinese: 谁能如熟练的花匠采花般，印证善说的真理之道？

sentences.english: My eyes meet yours in the water when we pick flowers by the lake.
sentences.chinese: 到湖边采花，与你的目光在水中相遇。

sentences.english: We hasten to gather our flowers lest they are plundered by the passing winds.
sentences.chinese: 我们忙去采花，怕被过路的风偷走。

sentences.english: The children are out in the field gathering flowers.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在外面地里采花。

sentences.english: Their groups, while flowers, while singing, all joy.
sentences.chinese: 他们成群结队，一边采花，一边唱歌，尽情欢乐。

definition: lit. stolen scent, pilfered jade (idiom); philandering/secret illicit sex
(of a flower) to attract bees and butterflies/(fig.) to attract the opposite sex/to flirt
to climb a wall/(fig.) to be unfaithful
lit. to enjoy the beautiful spring scenery (idiom)/fig. to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats

to play the xiao 簫|箫[xiao1] (mouth organ)/to beg while playing pipes; cf politician Wu Zixu 伍子胥[Wu3 Zi3 xu1], c. 520 BC destitute refugee in Wu town, 吳市吹簫|吴市吹箫[Wu2 shi4 chui1 xiao1]/to busk/virtuoso piper wins a beauty, cf 玉人吹簫|玉人吹箫[yu4 ren2 chui1 xiao1]/(slang) fellatio/blowjob
